ygData.subject: Re: [neat] New papers on evolving adaptive neural networks
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry, the previous message was meant to be sent to Sebastian Risi directy. That being said, if anyone else has any experience tying NEAT to Unity or Unreal,

Sorry, the previous message was meant to be sent to Sebastian Risi directy.=
 


That being said, if anyone else has any experience tying NEAT to Unity =
or Unreal, please let me know!

Cheers,
Sebastian

> Hey Sebastian!
> 
> 
>=
 Hab im Zuge deines Announcements auch deine Website gecheckt. Sehr cool ; =
) 
> 
> Werd mal sehen, ob sich meine studis f=C3=BCr euer UnityNEAT Projek=
t begeistern lassen=E2=80=A6
> 
> Cheers,
> Sebastian

>> On 24 Apr 2016, at 15:13, Sebastian Risi sebastian.risi=
@... <mailto:sebastian.risi@...> [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com <=
mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com>> wrote:
>> 
>> Hi all,
>> 
>> We're happy to a=
nnounce two new papers, which will be published at
>> GECCO that try to add=
ress the challenge of evolving adaptive neural
>> networks.
>> 
>> Evolving=
 adaptive neural networks has remained challenging, mainly
>> because of tw=
o reasons: (1) The networks have difficulties retaining
>> information over=
 longer periods of time, and (2) evolving the ability
>> to adapt has prove=
n to be a rather deceptive problem.
>> 
>> In our paper "Accelerating the E=
volution of Cognitive Behaviors
>> Through Human-Computer Collaboration" by=
 Mathias L=C3=B6we and myself, we
>> show that we can leverage human insigh=
ts during the search for
>> cognitive behaviors because of our ability to m=
ore easily distinguish
>> between adaptive and non-adaptive solutions than =
novelty or fitness-
>> based approaches. This paper shows that the recently=
 introduced method
>> novelty-assisted interactive evolution (NA- IEC), whi=
ch combines human
>> intuition with novelty search, allows the evolution of=
 cognitive
>> behaviors in a T-Maze domain faster than fully-automated sear=
ches by
>> themselves.
>> 
>> Link to the PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-=
content/uploads/loewe_gecco16.pdf <http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uplo=
ads/loewe_gecco16.pdf>
>> 
>> In our second paper "Evolving Neural Turing M=
achines for Reward-based
>> Learning" by Rasmus Boll Greve, Emil Juul Jacob=
sen, and myself, we
>> extend our recent work on evolving Neural Turing Mac=
hines to give ANNs
>> a more persistent type of memory. We show that the Ev=
olvable Neural
>> Turing Machine (ENTM) is able to solve a simple copy task=
s and for the
>> first time, the continuous version of the double T-Maze, a=
 complex
>> reinforcement-like learning problem. In theT-Maze learning task=
 the
>> agent uses the memory bank to display adaptive behavior that normal=
ly
>> requires a plastic ANN, thereby suggesting a complementary and
>> eff=
ective mechanism for adaptive behavior in NE.
>> 
>> Link to the PDF: http:=
//sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_gecco16.pdf <http://sebastianr=
isi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_gecco16.pdf>
>> 
>> Video of an agent expl=
oring the double T-Maze and ENTM source code:
>> http://sebastianrisi.com/e=
ntm <http://sebastianrisi.com/entm>
>> 
>> Looking forward to your comments=
!
>> 
>> Best,
>> Sebastian
>> 
>> -- 
>> Dr. Sebastian Risi
>> Associate P=
rofessor
>> IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D12
>> Rued Langgaards Vej 7=
, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
>> email: sebastian.risi@... <mailto:sebas=
tian.risi@...>, web: www.sebastianrisi.com <http://www.sebastianrisi.=
com/>
>> mobile: +45-50250355, office: +45-7218-5018
>> 
> 
> 
>
